bleeding.title: Severe Bleeding
bleeding._comments: keywords will be used in STT
steps: Sit or lay the person down
Apply firm pressure with a clean cloth
Do not lift hand off the wound
Keep pressure until bleeding slows
doNot: Do not wash the wound
Do not tie band too tight

burns.title: Burns
steps: Place the burned area under cold water
Cool for 10â€“15 minutes
Cover gently with a clean cloth
doNot: Do not apply ice directly
Do not apply oil or toothpaste

choking.title: Choking
steps: Lean the person forward
Give 5 back blows from behind
If needed, give 5 abdominal thrusts (Heimlich maneuver)
doNot: Do not put hands or objects in the throat
Do not slap the person

fracture.title: Fracture
steps: Do not move the affected limb
Immobilize with clean cloth or splint
Sit or lay the person comfortably
doNot: Do not forcibly set the bone
Do not press directly on the wound

snake_bite.title: Snake Bite
steps: Keep the person calm and still
Keep the affected area below the heart
Do not tie a tight band on the wound
doNot: Do not try to cut the wound
Do not apply ice or alcohol

electric_shock.title: Electric Shock
steps: Turn off the power source immediately
Ensure no current before touching the person
Lay the person flat and check breathing
doNot: Do not touch the person with current flowing
Do not lay in water

heat_stroke.title: Heat Stroke
steps: Take the person to a shady, cool place
Loosen clothing gently
Cool body with cold water or wet cloth
doNot: Do not force excessive water
Do not apply ice directly on skin

unconscious.title: Unconsciousness
steps: Place person in a safe position (recovery position)
Check breathing and pulse
Start CPR if not breathing
doNot: Do not shake the person
Do not give food or water

heart_attack.title: Heart Attack
steps: Sit or lay the person comfortably
Loosen tight clothing
Give aspirin if available
redFlags: Pain in left arm, jaw, or chest
doNot: Do not let the person walk
Do not delay

stroke.title: Stroke
steps: Lay the person on a flat surface
Turn head slightly to one side
Check speech and limb movement
doNot: Do not give food or water
Do not ignore the person

breathing_difficulty.title: Breathing Difficulty / Asthma
steps: Sit the person upright
Loosen tight clothing
Use inhaler if available
doNot: Do not lay the person down
Do not panic

poisoning.title: Poisoning
steps: Keep the person calm
Remember the poison container or name
Call medical help immediately
doNot: Do not induce vomiting forcibly
Do not give food or water

head_injury.title: Head Injury
steps: Keep the person still
Apply gentle pressure if bleeding
Observe the person
doNot: Do not move the head forcefully
Do not leave the person alone

allergic_reaction.title: Allergic Reaction
steps: Remove the person from the allergen
Keep the person comfortable
Use injection (EpiPen) if available
doNot: Do not take reaction lightly
Do not delay

child_emergency.title: Child Emergency
steps: Keep the child calm and safe
Check breathing and response
Call guardian or medical help
doNot: Do not leave the child alone
Do not force feed anything

fever_seizure.title: High Fever / Seizure
steps: Lay the person on their side
Keep sharp objects away
Wait for seizure to end
doNot: Do not put anything in mouth
Do not hold the person forcefully

hypothermia.title: Hypothermia
steps: Take the person to a dry, warm place
Remove wet clothes
Warm gradually with a blanket
doNot: Do not rub forcefully
Do not apply sudden heat
